definition: lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: The stirring event was well canvassed.
sentences.chinese: 那樁驚人的事情已經是滿城風雨。

sentences.english: There have been too much publicity about their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 他們的關係已經鬧得滿城風雨，人人皆知了。

sentences.english: Eric: Must be a lot of rumors why you're back.
sentences.chinese: 你一回來肯定滿城風雨了吧。

sentences.english: There had been too much publicity about their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 他們的關係已經鬧得滿城風雨，人人皆知了。

sentences.english: The film star's engagement with the mayor became the talk of the town.
sentences.chinese: 那個電影明星和市長訂婚弄得滿城風雨的。

sentences.english: The whole town was alive with talk about revolutionaries who were flooding the mills with their handbills.
sentences.chinese: 傳說革命者湧進工廠裏散發傳單，這事弄得滿城風雨。

sentences.english: Is still the cause uproar, it permeates in whatever you set foot in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 依舊是滿城風雨，它瀰漫在任何你涉足的土壤。

sentences.english: All London was talking about her affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她的事兒在倫敦鬧得滿城風雨。

sentences.english: But now my affair is fulled with the city and all people know.
sentences.chinese: 但我的事現在搞得滿城風雨，人人皆知了。

sentences.english: Before the matter was publicly announced, it had long been in the air.
sentences.chinese: 這件事在公諸於世之前早就傳得滿城風雨。

sentences.english: There have been too much publicity about her affair with the manager.
sentences.chinese: 她與經理的桃色事件已是滿城風雨，人人皆知了。

sentences.english: Bofore the matter was publicly announced, it had long been in the air.
sentences.chinese: 這件事在公諸於世之前早就傳得滿城風雨了。

sentences.english: Overnight, she became the talk of the town.
sentences.chinese: 一夜之間，她的八卦弄得滿城風雨。

definition: tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
a haze of doubts and suspicions
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
dangerous housing/building that is about to collapse
